location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.2329 of 1856 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, transmitting a letter from Soultan bin Sugur bin Rashid bin Mutur, the chief of Sharjah [Shaikh Sultan bin Saqr], addressed to the Governor in Council of Bombay, dated 3 February 1856. Shaikh Sultanâ€™s letter relates to the shipwreck and plunder of a vessel at Sharjah. the Sharjah ruler states that he has no means to pay the compensation, and that he feels he cannot be held responsible for a shipwreck that occurred beyond his power.
